intro: Oreocharis dasyantha var. ferruginosa, commonly known as the red-flowered oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often glandular, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variant is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
